name: NSTimeZone.NameStyle
desc: Constants you use to specify a style when presenting time zone names.

items.name: case standard
items.desc: Specifies a standard name style. For example, “Central Standard Time” for Central Time.

items.name: case shortStandard
items.desc: Specifies a short name style. For example, “CST” for Central Time.

items.name: case daylightSaving
items.desc: Specifies a daylight saving name style. For example, “Central Daylight Time” for Central Time.

items.name: case shortDaylightSaving
items.desc: Specifies a short daylight saving name style. For example, “CDT” for Central Time.

items.name: case generic
items.desc: Specifies a generic name style. For example, “Central Time” for Central Time.

items.name: case shortGeneric
items.desc: Specifies a generic time zone name. For example, “CT” for Central Time.
